text:
you're watching video vocab by 
business English pod dot-com

welcome back to video vocab TV this is the first 
of a two-part series on the planning process in

this episode we'll focus on the beginning 
stages of the planning cycle all businesses

and organizations need to decide where they want 
to go and how to get there to do this they rely

on good planning and the planning cycle planning 
can occur on a large scale like strategic planning

which determines the overall direction of a 
company it can also happen on a small scale

like project planning in which a specific piece 
of work is organized by an individual or project

team the first step in planning usually involves 
analyzing the situation problem or opportunity

from there the organization can determine 
the goals and desired outputs of the plan

it must then devise effective strategies to 
achieve these goals with the given resources

planners must carefully assess available 
inputs do a cost-benefit analysis and

conduct an environmental scan for large 
projects pest analysis is one commonly

used method of examining the external 
influences that may help or hinder a plan

now let's look at the vocabulary in more 
detail with some definitions and examples

planning planning in any organization planning is 
the process of creating and maintaining a plan we

often hear about the planning cycle which includes 
the creation implementation and review of plans we

also talked about different types of planning 
like strategic planning and project planning

mastering the entire planning cycle is crucial 
to the success of any business or organization

to analyze to analyze to analyze means to examine 
something very carefully or in great detail

analyzing involves breaking a situation 
down into its separate parts to figure

out how it works or to assess its strengths 
and weaknesses when the team analyzed the

production process they discovered a number 
of problems in the distribution process

goals goals goals are the accomplishments that the 
planning process is designed to achieve goals are

the entire purpose of plan they help a business 
or organization advance its overall mission the

goal of Tony's plan was very clear increase 
sales by 40 percent over the next six months

outputs outputs a plans outputs 
refers to what we want to have
or see accomplished at the end of a plan

outputs include our overall goals as well as the 
specific things or situations we want to create

the outputs of my cost-cutting plan 
included a 20% reduction in materials

costs and increased efficiency 
in our distribution methods

to devise devise to devise means to create arrange 
or form we often see this verb with nouns related

to plans for example you may hear devise a 
plan devise a strategy or devise a solution

when my boss told me about our 
scheduling difficulties I devised
a plan to have schedules updated automatically

strategy strategy a strategy outlines the 
methods or processes used to move a plan

towards its goals strategy relates to how 
we do things the senior managers had several

long meetings to work out the strategy for 
expanding into new markets inputs inputs

the resources that we put into a project or 
plan are fittingly called inputs inputs can

include human resources technologies money raw 
materials and ideas I had to revise my original

plan because it required very costly inputs 
particularly in terms of labor and materials

cost-benefit analysis cost-benefit analysis 
when we do a cost-benefit analysis we compare

the cost of different options against 
the expected benefits doing this type of

analysis helps planners choose the best goals 
and strategies the cost-benefit analysis of

expansion showed that it was better simply 
to increase sales to existing customers

environmental scan environmental scan in an 
environmental scan we examine the factors that

will affect the direction goals and processes of 
a plan an environmental scan done in the initial

stages of planning helps to create realistic 
expectations and goals an environmental scan

revealed that the company's plan to expand 
internationally would mean overcoming major

legal obstacles pest analysis pest analysis 
a pest analysis is one type of environmental

scan that examines political economic social 
and technological influences I commissioned a

pest analysis before deciding whether the new 
product would be accepted in the marketplace

external influences external influences 
external influences affect a plan or

project from outside an organization the 
project team was talented but they failed

because of several external influences 
including competition from another company

now it's your turn to practice some 
of the words we have studied in this

episode you'll hear a series of sentences 
with a word replaced with beep repeat the

whole sentence including the missing word 
for example if you hear the engineer had

to carefully the problem before 
deciding what needed to be done

you should say the engineer 
had to carefully analyze the
problem before deciding what needed to be done

we'll play an example answer after 
each question ready let's begin the

tech department was asked to a solution 
to the problem with the local area network
answer the tech department was asked to devise

a solution to the problem 
with the local area network

of all the plans required the most 
expensive is labor answer of all the
plans required inputs the most expensive is labor

the planets view the recent 
political turmoil as a very dangerous

answer the planners viewed the recent political 
turmoil as a very dangerous external influence you

I complain to my manager that we didn't have 
the resources needed to achieve the plans
answer I complain to my manager that we didn't

have the resources needed 
to achieve the plans goals

that's it for this episode of video 
vocab thanks for watching and see you

again soon video vocab is now available 
on a new website www.videoculinary.com
